page.title: 05THE ARRETON VALLEY FARMS
page.content: Hale Manor was built in 1560. The house is unusual because the original structure still stands. At present the house is lived in by Mr David Brown, his wife Mandy and their 3 children. The surrounding farm is part of a family farming company involving Mr Brown and his three brothers. The farming enterprise runs to 2,300 acres and comprises Hale Manor Farm, Haseley Farm, Combley Farm, Alerston Manor Farm, Pagham Farm, Great Budbridge Farm and Waightshale. There are two dairy herds of 120 cows each. All the calves are reared on the farms _ the steers reared for beef, and the heifers are put in calf at about 2 years. The livestock takes up about 800 acres. The remaining acreage is used for arable crops.
